document_data.caption: A depiction of a light aasimon.
document_data.name: Light
document_data.mainbody:
'''Light aasimon''', or simply '''lights''', were shapeless [[angel]]s composed of pure energy and goodness.

[[Mystryl]], the [[Netherese pantheon|Netherese]] goddess of [[magic]], utilized light aasimon as messengers.
document_data.Description: Lights appeared as small, swirling, constantly shifting mists of light. Deep within these mists, one could see a rainbow of changing colors. Some observers claimed that good beings would see memories of their best moments in life taking shape within the light's form. Evil creatures would instead heed visions of what might have been had they chosen the path of good.
document_data.Abilities:
Lights had all of the magical powers common to the other angels. In addition, they could create various forms of magical light, bestow [[bless]]ings upon others, [[dispel evil]], and [[Hold person|cause a person to cease movement]]. They were at all times [[Protection from evil|protected from evil]].

Lights were immune to mind-affecting spells, and good creatures found it nearly impossible to attack them. Lights could not be harmed by mundane weapons.

Unlike other angels, lights were able to create a ''[[gate]]'' to call assistance from an [[agathinon]].
document_data.Combat: Lights attacked by enveloping an evil enemy and damaging her or him with raw energy.
document_data.Society:
[[File:Light2e.png|thumb|right|250px|''A swirling mass of pure energy and goodness.'']]
Lights were sometimes sent to serve as temporary [[familiar]]s for powerful worshipers. To request a light aasimon familiar, a worshiper had to fast for three days and three nights, be baptized in [[holy water]], and cast or have cast the ''[[find familiar]]'' spell. This request was only answered about one time in ten, but when it was answered, this was a tremendous boon against the forces of evil. A light would never stay with a master for more than a single mission.

Lights were created by the good deities from the celestial essence of angels who had been slain while on other planes. For their sacrifices in their former forms, lights were viewed with awe by other [[celestial]]s.

There were only fewer than 1,000 lights in existence at any one time. Lights could be transformed into other celestial stewards by the will of the powers.
document_data.Ecology: Creatures of energy, lights subsisted from the energy supplied by their [[Cosmology|home plane]]. A light could not be destroyed, unless on its home plane. A light slain elsewhere would dissipate and simply reform on its home plane in one month's time.
